description: Creates a path to analyze for reachability. Reachability Analyzer enables you to analyze and debug network reachability between two resources in your virtual private cloud (VPC). For more information, see the Reachability Analyzer Guide.

parameters.name: Source
parameters.description: The ID or ARN of the source. If the resource is in another account, you must specify an ARN.

parameters.name: TagSpecifications
parameters.description: The tags to add to the path. (dict) --- The tags to apply to a resource when the resource is being created. When you specify a tag, you must specify the resource type to tag, otherwise the request will fail. ResourceType (string) --- The type of resource to tag on creation. Tags (list) --- The tags to apply to the resource. (dict) --- Describes a tag. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:. Value (string) --- The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_params.name: ResourceType
nested_params.description: The type of resource to tag on creation.

nested_params.name: Tags
nested_params.description: The tags to apply to the resource.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. For more information, see How to ensure idempotency. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

parameters.name: FilterAtSource
parameters.description: Scopes the analysis to network paths that match specific filters at the source. If you specify this parameter, you can't specify the parameters for the source IP address or the destination port. SourceAddress (string) --- The source IPv4 address. SourcePortRange (dict) --- The source port range. FromPort (integer) --- The first port in the range. ToPort (integer) --- The last port in the range. DestinationAddress (string) --- The destination IPv4 address. DestinationPortRange (dict) --- The destination port range. ToPort (integer) --- The last port in the range.

nested_params.description: The source IPv4 address.

nested_params.description: The source port range.

nested_params.description: The destination port range.

nested_params.name: FromPort

nested_params.name: ToPort
nested_params.description: The last port in the range.

parameters.name: FilterAtDestination
parameters.description: Scopes the analysis to network paths that match specific filters at the destination. If you specify this parameter, you can't specify the parameter for the destination IP address. SourceAddress (string) --- The source IPv4 address. SourcePortRange (dict) --- The source port range. FromPort (integer) --- The first port in the range. ToPort (integer) --- The last port in the range. DestinationAddress (string) --- The destination IPv4 address. DestinationPortRange (dict) --- The destination port range. ToPort (integer) --- The last port in the range.
